class specifix.segmentation.cli.converter.Converter(reference_filename: str)[source]

Bases: object

copy_metadata_from_array(image: Image, array: array, label=None)[source]

This function copies the metadata from an image to a new image which is generated from an numpy array and filtered for a specific label. If the label is None, then the metadata is copied to the original np.ndarray. :param image: sitk.Image The image that contains the desired metadata. :param array: np.ndarray The numpy array that should receive the metadata after it’s converted to sitk.Image. :param label: int Specifies if the array should be filtered for a specific label. :return: sitk.Image

copy_metadata_from_image(image: Image, label=None)[source]

This function copies the metadata from an sitk.Image and optionally filters it for a specific label. :param image: sitk.Image The image that contains the desired metadata. :param label: int Specifies if the sitk.Image should be filtered for a specific label. :return: sitk.Image

get_array_from_image(image: Image) → ndarray[source]

This method abstracts the original GetArrayFromImage function. It’s made in this way because later on the library used to manipulate the CT scans can be easily changed. :param image: sitk.Image :return: np.ndarray.

get_image_from_array(array: array) → Image[source]

This method abstracts the original GetImageFromArray function. It’s made in this way because later on the library used to manipulate the CT scans can be easily changed. :param image: np.ndarray :return: sitk.Imag

preprocess_image(image: Image) → Image[source]

DEPRECATED The idea of this function was to align the misaligned nifti files. :param image: :return:

stack_nrrd(label: str, prev: Image, new: Image)[source]

This method stacks two images on top of each other. They should have teh same dimensions and channels. It’s implemented in a way that it can be called recursively multiple times. To start the loop it should first be called with ‘None’ as parameter for the ‘prev’ argument as there won’t abe a ‘prev’ argument during this time.

Parameters:

  • label – the string representation of the label.

  • prev – sitk.Image represents the old image that will be used as base. If it’s none then the function will

automatically return the new image as the stacked one. :param new: sitk.Image represents the new image that has to be stacked on top of the “prev” image. :return: sitk.Image

convert_all()[source]

Converts multiple nifti files to nrrds. Each nifti file will be stored in a separate folder as explained in the self.to_label_nrrds function.

to_label_nrrds(nifti_filename: str) → list[float][source]

Converts one nifti file to multiple nrrds as it created a folder structure of: CT_NAME

  • nrrd

    • converted files

for each nifti file. :param nifti_filename: str representing the nifti filename that should be converted. :return: int returns the spacing of the nifti file.

to_label_tiffs(nifti_filename: str) → list[float][source]

Converts one nifti file to tiffs stored in a separate folder with the following structure: unique label 1

  • tiffs

unique label 2

  • tiffs

unique label 3

  • tiffs

for each unique label file. :param nifti_filename: str representing the nifti filename that should be converted. :return: int returns the spacing of the nifti file.

to_single_label_tiffs(nifti_filename: str) → list[float][source]

  • tiffs

class specifix.segmentation.cli.generator.Generator(input_directory: str, output_directory: str, reference_filename: str)[source]

Bases: BoneIOFileManager

append_record(ct_scan: str, filename: str, labels: dict, f: Image, s: Image)[source]

This function appends/stacks one image on top of another image. :param ct_scan: str the filename of the nifti file used for debug purposes. :param filename: str the filename used for mapping the variation of each label to its original name. :param labels: dict which contains all variations of the labels. It should be in the following format. key: str, value: object. You can find more information in the Config file. :param f: sitk.Image represents the old image that will be used as base. If it’s none then the function will automatically return the new image as the stacked one. :param s: sitk.Image represents the new image that has to be stacked on top of the “prev” image. :return: sitk.Image

clear()[source]

This function clears the access_count_dictionary. If some of the lines are checks it can throw errors indicating that a single CT scan contains multiple nrrds for a single label. :return: None

process_all()[source]

Process multiple CT scans. :return: None

process_single_ct_scan(ct_scan: str, output_filename: str)[source]

This function reads all nrrds corresponding to the passed CT scan filename and appends them to a single nifti file. The CT scan should be stored in the following way: CT_SCAN_NAME

  • nrrd

    • files

Parameters:

  • ct_scan – str the name of folder of the CT scan that contains its nrrds.

  • output_filename – str the output name of the generated nifti file.

Returns:

None

generate_mesh(nifti_filename: str)[source]

This function generates the meshes from a nifti file. The amount of meshes depends on the amount of unque labels of the nifti file. It uses Threads to run the genration process in parallel and speed up the execution time. :param nifti_filename: str the name of the nifti file. :return: None

    • nrrd

      • files

class specifix.segmentation.cli.mesh.Processor[source]

Bases: object

A utility class for processing VTK polydata using various filters and techniques for smoothing, resolution enhancement, cleaning, and connectivity analysis.

apply_advanced_smooting_filter(poly_data: vtkPolyData, iterations: int = 10, feature_angle: float = 120.0, pass_band: float = 0.001)[source]

Applies advanced smoothing using the Windowed Sinc PolyData Filter.

Parameters:

  • poly_data (vtk.vtkPolyData) – The input polydata to smooth.

  • iterations (int) – Number of smoothing iterations. Default is 10.

  • feature_angle (float) – Feature angle to preserve edges. Default is 120.0 degrees.

  • pass_band (float) – Pass band value for smoothing. Default is 0.001.

Returns:

Smoothed polydata.

Return type:

vtk.vtkPolyData

apply_cleaning(poly_data: vtkPolyData)[source]

Cleans the input polydata by merging duplicate points and removing unused points.

Parameters:

poly_data (vtk.vtkPolyData) – The input polydata to clean.

Returns:

Cleaned polydata.

Return type:

vtk.vtkPolyData

apply_connectivity_filter(poly_data: vtkPolyData)[source]

Applies a connectivity filter to the polydata to extract connected regions.

Parameters:

poly_data (vtk.vtkPolyData) – The input polydata.

Returns:

Polydata with connected regions identified.

Return type:

vtk.vtkPolyData

apply_gausian_smooting(poly_data: vtkPolyData, standard_deviation=0.5)[source]

Applies Gaussian smoothing to the input polydata.

Parameters:

  • poly_data (vtk.vtkPolyData) – The input polydata to smooth.

  • standard_deviation (float) – Standard deviation for Gaussian smoothing. Default is 0.5.

Returns:

Smoothed polydata.

Return type:

vtk.vtkPolyData

apply_marshing_cubes(poly_data: vtkPolyData, index_isosurface=0, value_isosurface=0.5)[source]

Extracts a surface using the Marching Cubes algorithm.

Parameters:

  • poly_data (vtk.vtkPolyData) – The input polydata.

  • index_isosurface (int) – The isosurface index. Default is 0.

  • value_isosurface (float) – The isosurface value. Default is 0.5.

Returns:

The extracted isosurface polydata.

Return type:

vtk.vtkPolyData

apply_subdivision_for_higher_resolution(poly_data: vtkPolyData, reduction_factor: float)[source]

Reduces the resolution of the polydata by applying a subdivision filter.

Parameters:

  • poly_data (vtk.vtkPolyData) – The input polydata.

  • reduction_factor (float) – The target reduction factor (0.0 to 1.0). Higher values reduce more.

Returns:

The resolution-reduced polydata.

Return type:

vtk.vtkPolyData

Perform morphological closing (dilation followed by erosion) on the mask.

process_ct_scan(ct_scan: str, labels_output_path: str)[source]

This function generates a shell for a single CT scan. It loops through the nrrds and generates a nifti file with their shelled version. The CT scan should be stored in the following way: CT_SCAN_NAME

  • nrrd

    • files

Parameters:

  • ct_scan – str the name of folder of the CT scan that contains its nrrds.

  • labels_output_path – str the output name of the generated nifti file.

Returns:

None

process_single_mask(mask: Image, filename: str)[source]

This function converts each nrrd to its slices and applies the shell algorithm on eahc slice. :param mask: sitk.Image representing the current nrrd. :param filename: str ussed to filter junk files generated by the labeling software. :return: None/processed slices and the sitk.Image object.

Remove any small internal artifacts that may remain inside the object.

Thicken boundary lines to avoid breaking during erosion.
